alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Chester; Western Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Chester and western Delaware Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Honey Brook, or 9 miles east of New Holland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Chester, Coatesville, Westtown, Downingtown, Parkesburg, Honey Brook, Cheyney, Marshallton, Lima, Chelsea, Lionville-Marchwood, Gradyville, Valley Forge, Glenmoore, Paoli, Chester Springs, Lionville, Concordville, Radnor Township and West Goshen. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 304 and 325. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
